definitions: periodical publication containing articles, photographs, and advertisements on various topics
building or room used for storing ammunition and explosives
detachable container holding cartridges to be fed into a firearm
examples: She subscribed to a fashion magazine for the latest trends
The magazine featured an exclusive interview with the president
The military inspected the magazine for proper storage conditions
Soldiers guarded the ammunition magazine throughout the night
He inserted a fresh magazine into his pistol
The rifle's magazine could hold thirty rounds

definitions: bright purplish-red color between red and purple in the spectrum
one of the primary colors used in color printing processes
examples: The sunset painted the sky in brilliant magenta hues
She chose magenta curtains to brighten the room
The printer ran out of magenta ink cartridge
Magenta combines with cyan and yellow in color printing

definitions: soft-bodied legless larva of a fly, typically found in decaying matter
examples: Maggots appeared in the garbage after several hot days
Fishermen use maggots as bait for catching trout

definitions: supernatural forces and powers believed to influence events through mysterious means
performance art using tricks and illusions to entertain audiences
extraordinary quality that makes something seem wonderful or exciting
examples: Ancient cultures believed in magic to heal diseases
The wizard cast magic spells to protect the village
The children watched the magic show with amazement
He learned magic tricks to perform at parties
There was magic in the air on their wedding day
The team's chemistry created magic on the basketball court

definitions: person who performs tricks and illusions as entertainment
person believed to have supernatural powers through magic
examples: The magician pulled a rabbit from his hat
She hired a magician for her son's birthday party
Medieval stories often featured magicians and wizards
The court magician advised the king on mystical matters

definitions: position or office of a magistrate in the judicial system
collective body of magistrates serving in a jurisdiction
examples: He was appointed to the magistracy after years of legal practice
The magistracy requires both legal knowledge and good judgment
The local magistracy handled minor criminal cases efficiently
Reform of the magistracy improved access to justice

definitions: civil officer who administers law, especially in minor cases
examples: The magistrate issued a warrant for the suspect's arrest
She appeared before the magistrate for a preliminary hearing

definitions: high-speed train system using magnetic levitation to move without touching tracks
examples: The maglev train reached speeds of 300 miles per hour
Japan's maglev technology revolutionized rail transportation

definitions: extremely hot liquid rock beneath Earth's surface that forms igneous rocks when cooled
examples: Magma rises through volcanic vents during eruptions
The geologist studied magma chambers beneath the volcano

definitions: wealthy and influential person in business or industry
examples: The oil magnate donated millions to charity
Media magnates control much of the news industry

definitions: white alkaline earth oxide used in medicine and industry, chemically magnesium oxide
examples: Magnesia is used as an antacid for stomach relief
The industrial process required magnesia as a refractory material

definitions: silvery-white metallic element essential for biological functions and used in alloys
examples: Magnesium supplements help prevent muscle cramps
The alloy contained magnesium for increased strength

definitions: object that produces a magnetic field and attracts iron and steel
person, place, or thing that attracts many people or things
examples: The magnet picked up all the metal filings
She used magnets to hang notes on the refrigerator
The new mall became a magnet for teenage shoppers
Silicon Valley is a magnet for tech entrepreneurs

definitions: physical phenomenon produced by moving electric charges resulting in attractive forces
powerful personal charm or appeal that attracts others
examples: Scientists studied magnetism to develop electric motors
The compass works through Earth's natural magnetism
His personal magnetism made him a natural leader
The actor's magnetism captivated audiences worldwide

definitions: black magnetic mineral consisting of iron oxide, an important iron ore
examples: Magnetite deposits were discovered in the mountain range
The compass needle aligned with the magnetite sample

definitions: process of making a material magnetic or the state of being magnetized
examples: The magnetization of iron creates permanent magnets
Scientists measured the rock's magnetization to determine its age

definitions: small electrical generator using permanent magnets to produce current for ignition
examples: The airplane's magneto provided spark for the engine
He repaired the magneto in the vintage motorcycle

definitions: region around a planet dominated by its magnetic field, protecting from solar radiation
examples: Earth's magnetosphere deflects harmful solar particles
Scientists study the magnetosphere using satellite data

definitions: action or process of making something appear larger than its actual size
degree to which something is magnified, expressed as a ratio or factor
examples: The magnification revealed tiny details invisible to naked eyes
Digital magnification enhanced the blurry photograph
The microscope provides magnification up to 1000 times
He adjusted the magnification to see cellular structures

definitions: quality of being extremely beautiful, elaborate, or impressive in appearance
examples: The palace's magnificence left visitors speechless
They marveled at the magnificence of the mountain landscape

definitions: great size or extent of something
degree of importance or seriousness of something
measure of earthquake strength on a logarithmic scale
measure of brightness of a celestial object
examples: The magnitude of the disaster became clear days later
Scientists calculated the magnitude of the tidal wave
Few understood the magnitude of the economic crisis
The magnitude of her achievement deserved recognition
The earthquake registered magnitude 7.2 on the Richter scale
Seismologists monitor earthquake magnitude constantly
The star's magnitude made it visible without telescope
Astronomers classify stars by their apparent magnitude

definitions: tree or shrub with large, fragrant flowers, typically white, pink, or purple
examples: The magnolia bloomed early in the southern spring
She planted a magnolia tree in her front yard

definitions: wine bottle containing 1.5 liters, twice the standard size
firearm using large-caliber ammunition for increased power
examples: They celebrated with a magnum of champagne
The collector bought a magnum of vintage bordeaux
The detective carried a .44 magnum revolver
The magnum cartridge provided superior stopping power

definitions: long-tailed bird with black and white plumage known for collecting shiny objects
person who collects or hoards things, especially indiscriminately
examples: The magpie chattered loudly from the tree branch
Magpies are known for their intelligence and curiosity
She was a magpie for vintage jewelry and trinkets
His magpie tendencies filled the house with collectibles

definitions: historical Indian prince or king ruling over a princely state
examples: The maharaja ruled the princely state for forty years
Palaces built by maharajas attract tourists to Rajasthan

definitions: alternate spelling of maharaja, an Indian prince or king
examples: The maharajah's jewels were displayed in the museum
British officials negotiated treaties with the maharajah

definitions: wife of a maharaja or a female ruler of an Indian princely state
examples: The maharani wore elaborate jewelry at court ceremonies
She ruled as maharani after her husband's death

definitions: Sanskrit title meaning great soul, used for a revered person especially Gandhi
examples: Mahatma Gandhi led India's independence movement peacefully
The title mahatma reflects great spiritual authority

definitions: Chinese tile-based game typically played by four players using decorated tiles
examples: The family gathered to play mahjong every Sunday
She learned mahjong from her grandmother in Shanghai

definitions: tropical hardwood tree valued for its durable reddish-brown timber
deep reddish-brown color resembling mahogany wood
examples: The antique desk was crafted from solid mahogany
Mahogany trees grow in tropical rainforests
She dyed her hair a rich mahogany shade
The leather sofa came in mahogany brown

definitions: female domestic servant who cleans and maintains a household
unmarried young woman, especially in historical or literary contexts
examples: The hotel maid cleaned the rooms every morning
They hired a maid to help with housework
The medieval tale featured a brave maid rescuing knights
The maid of honor stood beside the bride

definitions: unmarried young woman, especially in historical or literary contexts
first or earliest occurrence of something, especially in sports
examples: The knight rescued the maiden from the tower
Medieval maidens wore their hair long and uncovered
The ship's maiden voyage crossed the Atlantic
The pitcher threw a maiden over in cricket

definitions: female servant working in a household, especially in historical contexts
examples: The maidservant attended to the lady's needs
Victorian households employed several maidservants

definitions: letters and packages sent through the postal service
flexible armor made of metal rings or chains
electronic messages sent via email systems
examples: The mail arrived late due to the holiday
She sorted through the mail looking for bills
Medieval knights wore mail beneath their armor
The mail shirt protected against sword cuts
Check your mail for the meeting invitation
He received hundreds of mail messages daily

definitions: container for receiving delivered mail at a residence or business
electronic folder where email messages are received and stored
examples: The mailbox was full of holiday cards
He installed a new mailbox at the curb
Her mailbox had over 1000 unread messages
The spam filter kept junk out of his mailbox

definitions: container or envelope designed for mailing items safely
software program that sends bulk email or manages mailing lists
examples: She put the documents in a padded mailer
The bubble mailer protected the fragile item
The company used a mailer to send newsletters
Configure the mailer settings for automated emails

definitions: act of sending something through the postal system
list of names and addresses for sending mail to multiple recipients
examples: The mailing of invitations took all afternoon
Bulk mailing rates saved the company money
Update the mailing list with new subscribers
The mailing reached thousands of customers

definitions: person who delivers mail to homes and businesses
examples: The mailman arrived at the same time daily
Our friendly mailman knows everyone on the route

definitions: people who have been permanently injured or disabled, especially losing limbs
examples: The hospital treated the maimed from the accident
Veterans services helped the maimed adjust to civilian life

definitions: principal pipe or cable carrying water, gas, or electricity
the open ocean or high seas, especially in poetic usage
examples: The water main burst and flooded the street
Workers repaired the gas main after the leak
Pirates sailed the Spanish main seeking treasure
The ship ventured forth upon the main

definitions: powerful computer used primarily by large organizations for bulk data processing
examples: The bank's mainframe processed millions of transactions daily
They migrated data from the old mainframe to cloud servers

definitions: principal landmass of a country or continent, excluding islands
examples: Ferry service connects the island to the mainland
They moved from Hawaii to the mainland United States

definitions: principal mast of a sailing vessel, typically the second mast from the front
examples: The mainmast supported the largest sail on the ship
Storm damage cracked the mainmast requiring immediate repair

definitions: principal sail of a sailing vessel, attached to the mainmast
examples: The crew hoisted the mainsail to catch the wind
They reefed the mainsail as the storm approached

definitions: person or thing on which something depends for support or existence
examples: Tourism is the mainstay of the island's economy
She was the mainstay of the family during difficult times

definitions: ideas, attitudes, or activities shared by most people in society
examples: His music moved from underground to mainstream success
The mainstream media covered the story extensively

definitions: person responsible for keeping something in good condition or working order
examples: The software maintainer fixed bugs and updated features
Building maintainers ensure all systems function properly

definitions: process of maintaining or preserving something in good working condition
financial support provided to a former spouse or children after divorce
examples: Regular maintenance extends the car's lifespan significantly
The building requires constant maintenance and repairs
He pays monthly maintenance for his two children
The court ordered maintenance payments until remarriage

definitions: tall cereal plant producing kernels on large ears, also called corn
examples: Farmers planted maize across the midwest plains
Maize was first domesticated in ancient Mexico

definitions: title used when addressing or referring to a sovereign
impressive beauty, scale, or stateliness worthy of royalty
examples: Her Majesty the Queen will address parliament tomorrow
Your Majesty, the ambassador has arrived
They stood in awe of the mountain's majesty
The cathedral's majesty inspired religious devotion
